name: Special Agent Dale Cooper
description: Investigates the murder of Laura Palmer using unorthodox methods, falls in love with Twin Peaks and all its rural life, fascinated with the paranormal. He practices Buddhism.

name: Albert Rosenfield
description: Abrasive forensics expert, whose arrogant façade hides a spiritual nature

name: Chester Desmond
description: Investigates murder of Teresa Banks, mysteriously disappears

name: Sam Stanley
description: Forensics specialist, assists Desmond in the investigation of Teresa Banks' murder

name: Phillip Jeffries
description: Long-lost FBI agent, who knows of the Lodges and their inhabitants

name: Roger Hardy
description: Agent working for Internal Affairs who temporarily suspends Cooper from the FBI.

name: Gordon Cole
description: Regional Bureau Chief, known to shout because he is hard-of-hearing

name: Dennis/Denise Bryson
description: Transvestite DEA agent who investigates drug allegations against Dale Cooper

name: Diane
description: Agent Cooper's secretary; he starts most of his voice memos by addressing her by name. She is neither seen nor heard.

name: Sheriff Harry S. Truman
description: Lover of Josie Packard and friend of Cooper. Helps him solve the Laura Palmer case.

name: Deputy Andy Brennan
description: Dorky but brave deputy, on and off relationship with Lucy. Possibly father of her baby. Deciphered the Owl Cave petroglyph as a map.

name: Deputy Tommy "Hawk" Hill
description: Native American, expert tracker

name: Lucy Moran
description: Ditzy receptionist, on and off relationship with Deputy Brennan.

name: Cappy
description: Young, male assistant at the police station

name: Laura Palmer
description: Murder victim and the center of the story, linked to almost everyone in Twin Peaks

name: Leland Palmer
description: Laura's father, vessel for BOB, lawyer by profession and counsel for Ben Horne and the Great Northern Lodge.

name: Sarah Palmer
description: Laura's mother

name: Maddy Ferguson
description: Laura's nearly identical cousin

name: Doctor William Hayward
description: local practitioner in Twin Peaks, assists on the autopsy of Laura Palmer

name: Eileen Hayward
description: Doctor Hayward's wheelchair-bound wife

name: Donna Hayward
description: Laura's best friend, lover of James Hurley

name: Harriet Hayward
description: Donna's younger sister

name: Gersten Hayward
description: Donna's youngest sister

name: Ben Horne
description: Wealthy businessman, owns Great Northern Hotel, Horne's Department Store and a brothel on the Canada–US border

name: Jerry Horne
description: Ben's playboy brother and business partner

name: Sylvia Horne
description: Ben's constantly angry wife

name: Audrey Horne
description: Ben's sultry teenage daughter

name: Johnny Horne
description: Ben's mentally handicapped son, tutored by Laura

name: Josie Packard
description: Widowed sawmill owner with a dark past, lover of Sheriff Truman, tutored by Laura

name: Andrew Packard
description: Late owner of the Packard Sawmill and husband of Josie

name: Catherine Martell
description: Sister of Andrew, schemes with secret lover Ben Horne to burn down the sawmill

name: Pete Martell
description: Long-suffering husband of Catherine, fishing and chess enthusiast, found Laura's body

name: Major Garland Briggs
description: Intelligent and gifted Air Force officer involved in Project Blue Book, monitoring of deep-space and the woods surrounding Twin Peaks

name: Betty Briggs
description: Unassuming and loving wife and mother

name: Bobby Briggs
description: Rebellious teenager, captain of the football team, boyfriend of Laura Palmer, secret lover of Shelly Johnson

name: Big Ed Hurley
description: Owner of Big Ed's Gas Farm, secret lover of Norma Jennings

name: Nadine Hurley
description: Ed's one-eyed, super-strong, curtain drape-obsessed wife

name: James Hurley
description: Ed's nephew, secret lover of Laura Palmer, later lover of Donna Hayward

name: Norma Jennings
description: Double-R Diner owner, lover of Big Ed Hurley, organizer of Meals on Wheels with Laura

name: Hank Jennings
description: Norma's husband, convicted criminal on parole, conspirator with Josie Packard

name: Vivian Smythe Niles
description: Mother of Norma and Annie, is secretly a food critic

name: Annie Blackburn
description: Younger sister of Norma, an ex-nun with a troubled past

name: Leo Johnson
description: Wife-abusing Trucker and drug-runner, had a sexual relationship with Laura Palmer

name: Shelly Johnson
description: Abused young wife of Leo, waitress at Norma's diner, secret lover of Bobby Briggs

name: Jacques Renault
description: Canadian croupier, drug-runner, and bartender at the Roadhouse. Had sexual relationship with Laura Palmer

name: Bernard Renault
description: Youngest Renault brother, mules drugs over the border

name: Jean Renault
description: Oldest and most dangerous Renault brother, veteran criminal, insurance agent.

name: Blackie O'Reilly
description: Madam of One Eyed Jacks

name: Nancy O'Reilly
description: Blackie's sister, lover of Jean Renault

name: Ronette Pulaski
description: former employee of Horne's Department Store and One Eyed Jacks, was with Laura the night she died

name: Dr. Lawrence Jacoby
description: Eccentric former psychiatrist of Laura with an obsession for Hawaii

name: Mike Nelson
description: Bobby's best friend, high school wrestling champ, ex-boyfriend of Donna.

name:
Margaret Lanterman
 a.k.a. "The Log Lady")
description: Mystic, widow who divines through a log she carries with her everywhere

name: Harold Smith
description: Agoraphobic horticulturist, Laura's Meals on Wheels friend

name: Emory Battis
description: Store manager of Horne's Department Store, recruits girls from the perfume counter to work at One Eyed Jack's

name: Dick Tremayne
description: Pretentious employee of Men's Department at Horne's, ex-lover of Lucy

name: The Elderly Room Service Waiter
description: Elderly bellhop at the Great Northern with a link to the Lodges and the Giant in particular. Nicknamed Señor Droolcup by Albert Rosenfield.

name: Roadhouse Singer
description: Angelic singer at the Roadhouse, known for her dream-like voice

name: Mayor Dwayne Milford
description: Long-time mayor of Twin Peaks, has an ongoing feud with his brother Dougie

name: Dougie Milford
description: Publisher of the Twin Peaks Gazette local newspaper, known to marry often

name: Lana Budding Milford
description: Seductive fiancée of Dwayne, and widow of Dougie, known to charm almost any man that's around her

name: Evelyn Marsh
description: Rich woman who James Hurley runs into, and who is beaten by her husband

name: Malcolm Sloan
description: A man pretending to be Evelyn's brother.

name: Thomas Eckhardt
description: Former business partner of Andrew Packard, obsessively in love with Josie Packard

name: Jones
description: Thomas Eckhardt's assistant

name: Teresa Banks
description: First victim, found almost exactly one year before the murder of Laura Palmer

name: Windom Earle
description: Psychotic but brilliant ex-partner of Cooper, desires the powers of the Lodges

name: John Justice Wheeler
description: Friend of Ben Horne and later falls in love with Audrey Horne

name: Judy Swain
description: Foster care aid for orphan child

name: The Man from Another Place
description: Enigmatic dwarf, inhabitant of the Red Room.

name: MIKE
description: Spirit, former associate and now opponent of BOB, inhabits shoe salesman Phillip Gerard, "The One-Armed Man"

name: BOB
description: Malevolent spirit, haunts the woods and inhabits humans, killer of Laura.

name: The Giant
description: A supernatural giant who appears at key moments and provides Cooper with cryptic clues.

name: Mrs Tremond/Chalfont
description: Link to the Lodges and intentions unclear

name: Pierre Tremond/Chalfont
description: Mrs Tremond/Chalfont's grandson, link to the Lodges and intentions unclear
